Hi @dcaugher, I can see this PR has many irrelevant changes after the rebase, can you fix that?

You can run the following to rebase again
```
# pull the latest sonic-mgmt:master
# checkout to dcaugher:dcaugher-cisco-ecn-config-check-master branch
git reset --hard <your_latest_commit> # I believe it should be 699f4274c4263fa8c1edd937e13d95fc9430fce3
git rebase master 
# check git logs to make sure everything looks ok
git push -f
```

We are not seeing the issue described in this PR. that could be because we are using testbed-cli.sh and testbed.yaml (we do not define inband ips for our units). As a result, we dont have inband ips in our minigraph.yaml.
Looks like TestbedProcessing.py is legacy to be run manually. Are we still keeping this instead of using testbed-cli.sh?

@yyynini added a dependency for setup_module for swapsyncd to make sure counterpolling is disabled after the swap.
Hi @yyynini, please verify the latest change, thanks!

@rbpittman I'm still seeing the same failure in test_pfc_watermark_extra_lossless_active.
`E AssertionError: Watermark failures were found:
E For inner_dscp, outer_dscp, prio, queue = (3, 2, 3, 3):
E Failed to detect congestion due to PFC pause, failed check 19200 > 29200
E For inner_dscp, outer_dscp, prio, queue = (4, 6, 4, 4):
E Failed to detect congestion due to PFC pause, failed check 19200 > 29200`
Pls let me know if there's anything you'd like me to try or collect.

@yyynini Updated description, I got a clean pass for the entire file running off hash 20aae03. Also got a pass for the watermark test case on a 202411 double commit preview, both with the double-swap-syncd and single-swap-syncd fixture change. 
Any chance the fix isn't making it into the test run?

hi @xwjiang-ms I remember there were issues when we bump up the vs memory, do we see issues with memory increase of PTF?

> hi @xwjiang-ms I remember there were issues when we bump up the vs memory, do we see issues with memory increase of PTF?

@Pterosaur @StormLiangMS Our KVM test server only has 32G/64G memory and swap memory was not enabled, so it may cause memory issue in PR test, if you need more memory, please add specific topology, and if we need to add the topology in PR test, we need a new type of VM with larger memory

> > hi @xwjiang-ms I remember there were issues when we bump up the vs memory, do we see issues with memory increase of PTF?
> 
> @Pterosaur @StormLiangMS Our KVM test server only has 32G/64G memory and swap memory was not enabled, so it may cause memory issue in PR test, if you need more memory, please add specific topology, and if we need to add the topology in PR test, we need a new type of VM with larger memory

For the new full topology, I agree that we need VM with larger memory. This change is to increase the memory limitation of PTF container. It doesn't actually increate PTF container memory usage. It should be OK for now. I am OK with this change.
hi @Pterosaur , do you mind to help cherry pick this to 202412?

Hi @prsunny , could you help review the PR? Thanks!
@ZhaohuiS please review this test PR as well for cacl.

@weiguo-nvidia without this change, will PR test fail for submodule advanced PR of [301](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301/files)? If so, you need to skip this case in conditional mark. Until image change is merged, remove it from conditional mark and make sure the change in this PR is merged. Otherwise, there will be deadlock for PR test of advanced PR.

> PR [sonic-net/sonic-host-services#301](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301)

Yes, you are right. The PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301 has not been merge, the case will fail if the current PR merge.
I have moved the current PR to "Draft" status and will merge it after PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301 is merged
PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301 had been merged, so the current PR can be merged, please review
@ZhaohuiS Can you please help to review?

@nhe-NV please add skip condition for test_cacl_application.py, otherwise, all PR test will fail in sonic-mgmt.
you can remove the skip condition until https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301 is merged into master image.

> @nhe-NV please add skip condition for test_cacl_application.py, otherwise, all PR test will fail in sonic-mgmt. you can remove the skip condition until [sonic-net/sonic-host-services#301](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/301) is merged into master image.

@ZhaohuiS The image PR already merged to master last week.
@nhe-NV But submodule PR is not advanced to master branch. To avoid deadlock, please skip this script from PR test, otherwise it will impact many PR tests in sonic-mgmt repo.

> @nhe-NV But submodule PR is not advanced to master branch. To avoid deadlock, please skip this script from PR test, otherwise it will impact many PR tests in sonic-mgmt repo.

In such case, we can wait the submodule to included in the sonic-buildimage, then merge this PR, how do you think ?

@nhe-NV impossible, because submodule advance PR needs this test case change to get merged, otherwise, its PR test will keep failing. that's the deadlock, we have to skip this test case in order to get both PRs merged.

> @nhe-NV impossible, because submodule advance PR needs this test case change to get merged, otherwise, its PR test will keep failing. that's the deadlock, we have to skip this test case in order to get both PRs merged.

hi @rgarofano-arista you may check this file, https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/common/plugins/conditional_mark/tests_mark_conditions.yaml, we can skip per test case.

> hi @rgarofano-arista you may check this file, https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/common/plugins/conditional_mark/tests_mark_conditions.yaml, we can skip per test case.

Yes, we can. However, there are only two test cases and this is a large test. By skipping the `telemetry/test_events.py::test_events` test case, we would be skipping the following events:
```
bgp_events.py
dhcp-relay_events.py
event_utils.py
eventd_events.py
host_events.py
run_events_test.py
swss_events.py
```
The change I am proposing only skips `swss_events.py` which is the only one that uses `pfcwd`. Perhaps arista could look into creating separate test cases for each of these event types, but I personally am of the opinion that skipping the entire test case is too aggressive the way the test is written today.

> @ZhaohuiS , @StormLiangMS , is this ready for merge? do we have test results for all platforms?
> 
> @prabhataravind , can we ensure this test is running on SS SKUs

hi @prsunny We have only implemented the test for the Broadcom platform. Other platforms should have similar mechanisms for ECMP offset configuration, but since we have limited knowledge in those areas, Cisco and Mellanox may need to implement their respective parts. To avoid conflicts, we separated the implementation into PI and PD layers. This way, adding support for other platforms does not require modifying the PI code, which defines the test procedure and methodology — only the PD code needs to be updated to provide the platform-specific method for modifying the ECMP offset.
